front.title: Domain Subobjects for Resource ReserVation Protocol - Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE)

abstract.t: The RSVP-TE specification [RFC3209] and the GMPLS extensions to RSVP-TE [RFC3473] allow abstract nodes and resources to be explicitly included in a path setup. Further Exclude Routes extensions [RFC4874] allow abstract nodes and resources to be explicitly excluded in a path setup. This document specifies new subobjects to include or exclude domains during path setup where domain is a collection of network elements within a common sphere of address management or path computational responsibility (such as an IGP area or an AS (4-Byte)). Note that the use of Autonomous Number (AS) (2-Byte) as an abstract node representing domain is already defined in [RFC3209] and [RFC4874].
